div.p: Greetings and best wishes. The fact that I have not sent you any letters for a little while (most illustrious man) should be an indication that I have had nothing worthy of writing; moreover, I have always considered it wrong to burden you, who are occupied with so many and such serious matters, with empty letters. Even now, unless requested by friends, I had no intention of troubling you with writing; but I had to comply with the insistence of friends. Therefore, I ask your kindness to forgive me. Herr Philipp Gallitz, who, while he lived, was most loving and respectful towards you, sir, among other children, also had this one, who...
